description: Ms. codex. Title from title page (fol. 1a). Physical description: 23 lines per page. Written in medium large naskh in black ink with use of red. Yāʾ for alif maqṣūrah ; final yāʾ dotted. The text is partially vocalized. Fol. 43-44 and 51-54 are later replacements. Marginal annotations. The text has been collated. Several inscriptions on fol. 1a, including audition statements (samāʻ) and ownership statements. Modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals. Chiefly quinions. Catchword on the verso of each leaf ; the quires are numbered using Arabic ordinals (see "al-Thānī" on fol. 9a). Inscription in Arabic script in red pencil on fol. 1a: "Raqm 453" and "Raqm 718". Origin: According to colophon, copied by Ilyās ibn Ibrāhīm al-Khaṭīb bi-ʻAyn al-Zaytūn [near Ṣafad], Friday 10 Muḥarram 725 [Dec. 1324] (fol. 190a, collation statements on the margin). Incipit: بسم ... وما توفيقى الا بالله عليه توكلت قال الشيخ الامام العللم العامل الورع الزاهد المتقن المحقق محيي الدين يحيى بن شرف بن مري بن حسن بن حسين النواوي رحمه الله الحمد لله الواحد القهار العزيز الغفار مقدر الاقدار مصرف الامور ... اما بعد فقد قال الله العظيم العزيز الحكيم فاذكروني اذكركم Explicit: وساير الصالحين اخر الكتاب قال مصنفه ابو زكريا يحيي بن شرف غفا الله عنه فرغت من جمعه في محرم سنه سبع وستين وستمايه
author: Nawawī, 1233-1277
abstract: Collection of ḥadīth arranged by topics. According to the end of this copy, the work was completed in Muḥarram 667 [1268].
extent: 192 leaves : paper ; 247 x 173 (190 x 135) mm. bound to 255 x 185 mm.
title: Kitāb al-Adhkār
uniform title: حلية الابرار وشعار الاخيار في تلخيص الدعوات والاذكار المستحبة في الليل والنهار
provenance: Audition statement mentioning Damascus on fol. 1a. Two ownership statements on fol. 1a, in the name of al-Shaykh Ḥasan ibn al-Ḥājj Aḥmad Darūbī [Ḥasan ibn Aḥmad Darūbī] and of Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Aḥmad. Ownership and reading statements on fol. 190b-191a, Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.
creator: نووي
subject: Islamic law—History—13th century—Sources
binding note: Brown leather over paper pasteboards with flap. The covers have a central panel defined by fillets with a border consisting of two running patterns, one with small gold stamped dots. The panel is heavily tooled, with a geometrical pattern developing from a central twelve pointed star. Gold stamped dots. Similar geometrical pattern on the envelope flap, with a medallion filled with a six pointed star. Rebacked ; fore-edge flap is a later replacement. Modern paper pastedowns.
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
